column4: you guys ever reinstalled windows in a dual boot system without disrupting the linux side?
any tricks?  i have a vista partition and a recovery partition that i can use to reinstall a diff version of windows
do want to install ubuntu and vista again? side by side
didn't mean to hit return.  those are the partitions i would like to rewrite, but leave the ubuntu where its at
so you have ubuntu and vista already installed?
at the grub prompt can you boot into windows vista?
i can boot into vista if i change the bios from ide mode to the other option
Sorry but i cannot help with this however if you wanted to re install and overright the windows partition the use gparted or just reinstall vista from the install disc?
basically i want to install windows 7 on the vista partition
not the rc, the oem copy i guess... what they have at msdnaa
Ok well insert the iso you burnt with windows 7 and install that on the vista partition however you will loose whats on that partition
i'm not really concerned about the vista partition really... i just want to make sure that i don't do anything to damage the linux partitions
Or use virtualbox and just install windows 7 on that, sorry but i cannot help with windows as this is a ubuntu channel
i suggest virtualbox with windows 7 as windows 7 is still in rc and may contain bugs or wreck your system
